results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions

results.title: Dinosaurs on earth: then and now
results.brief_description: The world of dinosaurs comes alive through animation, based on the expertise of palaeontologists, recent fossil discoveries, skeletal reconstructions, and revealing comparisons with animals who currently reside on Earth. Beginning with the origin of life on Earth to the “Age of the Dinosaurs”, this video explains how all that we know about these extinct animals, including how they lived, hunted and killed has come from the fossil record. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: Dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Steve Skok and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Schools Div, Victoria
results.brief_description: Fossil records show that the dinosaurs were an enormously successful group containing many species. This program examines the reasons why they were so prolific and discusses some of the theories behind their disappearance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bence, Steve Skok and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Schools Div, Victoria

results.title: Dinosaurs
results.brief_description: Dinosaurs follows the life of a family of dinosaurs, living in a modern world. They have TV’s, fridges, microwaves, and every modern convenience.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

results.description: Dinosaurs follows the life of a family of dinosaurs, living in a modern world. They have TV’s, fridges, microwaves, and every modern convenience.
description_for_label: Dinosaurs follows the life of a family of dinosaurs, living in a modern world. They have TV’s, fridges, microwaves, and every modern convenience.

results.title: Dinosaur! Parts 3 & 4
results.brief_description: Two further parts of the series tracing the history of the scientific hunt for evidence to increase our knowledge of the giant dinosaurs who disappeared from the world 65 million years ago. Part 3: “The Tale of an egg” begins with the discovery of the first dinosaur egg in China in the 1920’s. It then concentrates on the clues discovered by the “Dinosaur Detectives” to piece together the habits and social life of dinosaurs. Part 4: “The Tale of a feather” firstly concentrates on the fossilised feather found in southern Germany which led to the discovery of a “missing link” creature, half bird and half reptile. It then goes on to investigate the causes of the extinction of all dinosaurs.

results.title: Dinosaur! Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Dinosaurs (meaning “terrible lizards”) appeared 210 million years ago, ruled the world for 150 million years and then disappeared 65 million years ago. Their world has only become known to us in the past hundred years. This video has the first two episodes from the fascinating Granada Television series on the history of the scientific “Dinosaur Detectives” who gradually pieced together this long forgotten world. Part 1: “The Tale of a tooth” tells of the first discoveries of dinosaur fossils, beginning with a gigantic tooth discovered in England by British scholar, William Buckland in 1817. Part 2: “The Tale of the bones” shows the techniques used by modern palaeontologists and modelmakers to recreate accurately the original appearance of over 1000 species of dinosaurs.

results.title: Dinosaur tracks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson and his friends get together in six stories. In “Diesel tries to fly” all the toys are put in danger as Diesal tries out his wings. Squeaky’s good at guarding the bedroom but what about the “Dinosaur tracks”? Is Johnson falling apart as the toys follow the mysterious “Pink thread.” “Melissa’s dinosaur”, Victoria is introduced to the toys. In “Diesel who?”, the toy loses his memory after a nasty crash. McDuff feels very superior after a visit to the toyshop, and the toys try to get her back to her old self in The Homecoming.

results.title: Dinosaur junction series
results.brief_description: This video contains three short episodes of ‘Dinosaur Junction’ which uses animated dinosaurs to illustrate in a fun way how children can learn to cope with problems they face such as peer pressure and fighting. ‘Doin’ it you way’ looks at decision making and peer pressure; ‘The fight’ looks at controlling your temper and dealing with anger; ‘What’s in a name’ looks at self esteem and fitting in. Suitable for Primary level students.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated figures and simple chalk line drawings are transformed into awe-inspiring prehistoric animals in this interpretation of our earth as it existed long before man. A fastpaced motivating introduction to dinosaurs and their prehistoric world, suitable for children of all ages.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures, artfully combined live action backgrounds with CGI pre-historic beasts. This family oriented adventure movie is about an orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs. Years later when the inhabitants flee the continent, Aladar, as he is known, encounters his own kind for the first time. The landmark animation of this feature was highly praised for its attention to detail and awe-inspiring aesthetics. Features the voices of D.B. Sweeney, Alfre Woodard, Ossie Davis, Max Casella, Hayden Panettiere, and Sam Wright.
